QAPair.Question: Do you have information about MRI
QAPair.Answer: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan is an imaging test that uses powerful magnets and radio waves to create pictures of the body. It does not use ionizing radiation (x-rays). Single MRI images are called slices. The images can be stored on a computer or printed on film. One exam can produce thousands of images. Different types of MRI include: Abdominal MRI , Cervical MRI , Chest MRI , Cranial MRI , Heart MRI , Lumbar MRI , Pelvic MRI , MRA (MR Angiography) , MRV (MR Venography),
